intro: Telipogon nervosus, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Telipogon nervosus is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
